name: stable-tool
description: A mature DMX lighting controller that just works.
notes: Rock-solid DMX controller used in dozens of production installations. Hasn't needed major changes in over a year because it does its job well.

name: active-framework
description: Creative coding framework with frequent updates and new features.
notes: Powerful but the API changes frequently. Pin your version and read the changelog before upgrading. Great for prototyping, requires more care in long-running installations.

name: new-signage
description: Lightweight digital signage CMS for Raspberry Pi.
notes: Promising new option for Pi-based signage. Still young â€” we've tested it on two kiosks but wouldn't deploy it at scale yet. Worth watching.

name: abandoned-mapper
notes: Was great in its day but hasn't been updated in over two years. Still works for simple mappings but don't expect bug fixes. Listed here so people know it exists before building their own.

name: retired-monitor
description: Process health monitor for installation fleets. Archived.
notes: Maintainers moved on to a commercial product. Code still works but no updates coming. Consider healthchecks or netdata instead.

name: fleet-manager
description: Manage and deploy to fleets of embedded Linux devices.
notes: We've used this to manage 40+ Pis across three venues. OTA updates work reliably. The web UI is rough but the core functionality is solid. Less complex than open-balena if you don't need container orchestration.
